thread.title: Smoking card reader forces Alaska Airline flight to emergency landTravelandtourworld.com
thread.title_full: Smoking card reader forces Alaska Airline flight to emergency landTravelandtourworld.com

author: travelandtourworld.com
title: Smoking card reader forces Alaska Airline flight to emergency landTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Smoking card reader forces Alaska Airline flight to emergency land
Flight 17 of Alaska Airlines, which was heading from Newark to Seattle, had to make an emergency landing in Buffalo on Monday morning after a credit card device began emitting smoking from what appeared to be the battery compartment of the device.
Alaska Airlines said the plane, a Boeing 737-900ER with 181 passengers and six crew members onboard, landed safely and without incident at 8:15 a.m., with no injuries.
The card reader in question was kept in the galley at the rear of the aircraft when it overheated, the airline stated and “while there were no flames during the flight crew did use a fire extinguisher to stop the device from smoking while the captain arranged for an emergency landing in Buffalo, New York.”
The mobile devices used onboard Alaska Airlines flights to ring up credit card charges for food and beverage purchases are new to the airline and will be removed from aircraft for the time being for inspection.
Flight crews will still be able to process payments as Alaska will bring back its previous devices until the new machines are cleared for operation.
The passengers diverted in the morning, the airlines said they would be re-booked onto another aircraft, Flight 9232, scheduled to depart from Buffalo at 5:20 p.m. local time.
